Research questions ‘iron deficiency’ as key cause of anaemia in India - The Hindu
summary:
Research questions ‘iron deficiency’ as key cause of anaemia in India

Published: January 17, 2025

Source: The Hindu

A recent study suggests that the traditional belief that iron deficiency is the primary cause of anaemia in India may be outdated, highlighting alternative factors such as Vitamin B12 deficiency and air pollution. The findings call for a review of public health policies regarding anaemia.

  • The study was published in the European Journal of Clinical Nutrition.
  • Anaemia affects 34.9% of the population tested, but only 9% had iron-deficiency anaemia.
  • Prevalence of anaemia in women of reproductive age increased from 53.2% to 57.2% as per the latest National Family Health Survey.
  • Other causes of anaemia include deficiencies in nutrients like B12 or folate and environmental factors such as pollution.
  • The study indicates the need for diversified dietary policies and holistic approaches, rather than focusing solely on iron supplementation.
“The key is to diversify diets. We have to intervene with ensuring more fruits, milk and vegetables are made available to a wider population which will improve absorption of essential nutrients.” - Dr. Anura Kurpad

The findings of this study advocate for more comprehensive public health strategies to combat anaemia in India.
newTitle: Research Questions Iron Deficiency as Key Cause of Anaemia in India

“The Galaxy S25 series will come with cutting-edge features, powered by the new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.”

The Galaxy S25 series is shaping up to be a significant upgrade over its predecessor, combining enhanced performance with innovative AI features.

U.S. Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok - The Hindu
summary:
U.S. Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The U.S. Supreme Court has upheld a law requiring TikTok's Chinese parent company, ByteDance, to divest the app or risk being banned on national security grounds, affecting its over 170 million American users.

  • The court's decision overturned a lower court's ruling.
  • The law was enacted by a bipartisan majority and highlights national security concerns regarding data collection by foreign adversaries.
  • TikTok has argued this law endangers First Amendment rights for U.S. users.
  • The law could lead to TikTok ceasing operations in the U.S. if no deal is reached before the deadline.
“There is no doubt that, for more than 170 million Americans, TikTok offers a distinctive and expansive outlet for expression...”

The ruling raises implications for free speech amidst growing tensions between the U.S. and China, with the incoming Trump administration signaling a willingness to negotiate a deal to keep TikTok operational.
newTitle: U.S. Supreme Court Rules Against TikTok, Upholding Sale or Ban Requirement

title: 'Emergency' movie review: From 'iron lady' to meek mimicry: Kangana's Indira falls short - Deccan Herald
summary:
Emergency Movie Review: From 'Iron Lady' to Meek Mimicry

Published Date: 17 January 2025, Source: Deccan Herald

Director Kangana Ranaut's film Emergency attempts to portray a tumultuous phase in Indian democracy but falls short of delivering a compelling narrative, instead marred by melodrama and a lack of nuance.

  • The film opens with an extensive disclaimer about its historical inspirations.
  • Kangana portrays Indira Gandhi, focusing on her quirks rather than her commanding presence.
  • Characters like Jayaprakash Narayan and Atal Bihari Vajpayee break into musical performances, detracting from the gravity of the subject matter.
  • Significant historical events are packed into the script but often presented without sufficient context.
  • Vishak Nair's portrayal of Sanjay Gandhi stands out amidst other exaggerated performances.
“Indira's fixation on power led to her downfall. The absence of nuance and slapdash making sink Emergency. As for subtlety, rest in peace.”

The film tries to encapsulate Indira Gandhi's complex legacy but ultimately fails to resonate, lacking depth and a coherent storyline.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency': A Disappointing Portrayal of Indira Gandhi

title: Cancer rate sees an alarming rise in young females; Know the most common cancers in women - The Times of India
summary:
Cancer Rate Sees Alarming Rise in Young Females

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article discusses the concerning increase in cancer rates among young females, highlighting the most common types of cancers affecting women today.

  • The overall cancer rates in young females are rising significantly.
  • Breast cancer remains the most common cancer among women.
  • Other prevalent cancers include cervical cancer and ovarian cancer.
  • The article emphasizes the importance of early detection and regular check-ups.
“Early detection can lead to better outcomes for women battling cancer.”

This increase in cancer rates serves as a critical reminder of the necessity for education, awareness, and proactive health measures among young women.

title: Israel’s security Cabinet recommends approval of ceasefire in Gaza; awaits full Cabinet’s decision - The Hindu
summary:
Israel’s security Cabinet recommends approval of ceasefire in Gaza; awaits full Cabinet’s decision

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: The Hindu

After months of conflict with Hamas, Israel’s security Cabinet has recommended approval for a ceasefire deal on January 17, 2025. This deal aims to pause the ongoing war and facilitate the release of hostages.

  • The ceasefire deal was announced by mediators Qatar and the U.S. on January 15, 2025.
  • This recommendation comes after Prime Minister Netanyahu confirmed an agreement to pause hostilities and begin releasing hostages.
  • The ceasefire could begin as early as January 19, 2025, pending approval from the full Cabinet.
  • The agreement aims to release 33 hostages in exchange for hundreds of imprisoned Palestinians.
  • Resistance from far-right coalition partners poses potential challenges to Netanyahu's government stability.
“If the ‘deal’ passes, we will leave the government with a heavy heart.” - Itamar Ben-Gvir, Israel's National Security Minister

The anticipated ceasefire holds the potential to dramatically alter the current situation in Gaza, but significant resistance exists within the Israeli government.
newTitle: Israel's Security Cabinet Approves Ceasefire; Final Decision Awaits Full Cabinet

On January 17, 2025, Kangana Ranaut’s film Emergency hit theaters, with audiences eager to see her representation of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. Fans took to social media to share their positive reactions to her impactful performance.

title: Israel’s Security Cabinet greenlights Gaza ceasefire deal, hostage release expected - Moneycontrol
summary:
Israel’s Security Cabinet greenlights Gaza ceasefire deal, hostage release expected

Date: January 17, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Israeli Security Cabinet has recommended a ceasefire deal to pause the ongoing war with Hamas and facilitate the release of hostages.

  • The ceasefire deal is expected to begin on January 19, 2025.
  • It follows a cross-border attack by Hamas on October 7, 2023, which killed approximately 1,200 Israelis.
  • Over 46,000 Palestinians have reportedly died as a result of the conflict, with many casualties being women and children.
  • Despite the deal, Netanyahu's government faces opposition from far-right coalition partners.
“A deal is in place,” said Prime Minister Netanyahu, reflecting on the hostage situation.

The ceasefire represents a potential shift in the ongoing conflict, but the opposition could destabilize the current government structure.
newTitle: Israel's Security Cabinet Approves Gaza Ceasefire Deal Expected to Release Hostages

title: 'Wanted to establish Nazi-style dictatorship': Telugu youth gets 8 years in prison for White House attack - The Times of India
summary:
Telugu Youth Sentenced to 8 Years for Attempted White House Attack

Publication Date: Recent | Source: Times of India

An 8-year prison sentence has been handed down to a Telugu youth for attempting to carry out an attack on the White House, as part of a plan to establish a regime reminiscent of Nazi Germany.

  • The individual intended to create a 'Nazi-style dictatorship'.
  • Details of the case reveal a troubling ideology driving the actions of the youth.
  • The sentence demonstrates a strong judicial response to threats against national security.
“This sentence should serve as a warning that such ideologies and actions will not be tolerated.”

The case highlights a concerning intersection of ideology and criminal intent, emphasizing the importance of monitoring extremist movements.
newTitle: Telugu Youth Sentenced to 8 Years for Attempted White House Attack

title: How drinking coffee like THIS can sharpen memory, boost brain health - The Times of India
summary:
How Drinking Coffee Without Sugar Can Boost Brain Health

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

New research highlights the benefits of consuming unsweetened coffee for brain health, revealing a correlation between unsweetened coffee intake and a lower risk of neurodegenerative diseases among older adults.

  • A study published in the American Journal of Clinical Nutrition showed that older adults who drink unsweetened coffee have a 29-30% reduced risk of Alzheimer's and related diseases.
  • Participants consuming two to three cups of coffee daily had a 45% lower risk of suicide compared to non-coffee drinkers.
  • Unsweetened coffee drinkers demonstrated a 43% lower mortality risk from neurodegenerative diseases.
  • Caffeine may enhance memory by increasing neurotransmitters that stabilize the blood-brain barrier.
  • The FDA recommends not exceeding 400 mg of caffeine daily, equivalent to about four cups of coffee.
“Drinking four to six cups of coffee daily was linked to a lower incidence of stroke and dementia.”

Overall, limiting sugar intake in coffee could have significant long-term benefits for brain health and well-being.
newTitle: How Drinking Coffee Without Sugar Can Boost Brain Health

title: Unsweetened coffee's brain-boosting benefits: How it sharpens memory, cuts Alzheimer's risk - The Times of India
summary:
Unsweetened Coffee's Brain-Boosting Benefits: How it Sharpens Memory, Cuts Alzheimer's Risk

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: American Journal of Clinical Nutrition

This article discusses the significant benefits of consuming unsweetened coffee, particularly its positive effects on brain health and reduced risk of neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer's, dementia, and Parkinson’s disease, according to a recent study.

  • Older adults with higher intake of unsweetened coffee show a 29-30% lower risk of Alzheimer’s.
  • Participants who did not sweeten their coffee had a 43% lower risk of mortality from these diseases.
  • Consumption of two to three cups of coffee daily is associated with a 45% lower risk of suicide.
  • Unsweetened coffee is rich in antioxidants and essential nutrients that contribute to lower risks of brain disorders.
“Caffeine may stimulate neurotransmitters that help improve memory and stabilize the blood-brain barrier.”

The findings highlight the advantages of opting for unsweetened coffee not only for its flavor but also for its health benefits, illustrating how dietary choices can significantly impact long-term cognitive health.
newTitle: Unsweetened Coffee's Brain-Boosting Benefits: Memory and Alzheimer's Risk Reduction

title: Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees - Mint
summary:
Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Wipro Ltd reported a voluntary attrition rate of 15.3% for Q3 of the financial year 2024-25, up from 14.2% in the same quarter last year. The company’s headcount decreased by 1,157 to a total of 2,32,732 employees.

  • Consolidated net profits increased by 24.5% YoY to ₹3,353.8 crore.
  • Revenue from operations rose nearly 1% to ₹22,319 crore.
  • Wipro declared an interim dividend of ₹6 per equity share, with a record date set for January 28, 2025.
“In a seasonally weak quarter, our strong in-quarter execution helped us deliver above the top end of our revenue guidance,” said Srini Pallia, CEO.

The company's shares dropped 2.15% to ₹281.85 ahead of the earnings announcement.

This increase in attrition and decrease in headcount suggests ongoing challenges in workforce retention within the IT sector.
newTitle: Wipro Q3 Attrition Rate Increases to 15.3%, Headcount Decreases

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping will skip Trump’s inauguration, sending a special representative in his place - CNN
summary:
Xi Jinping Skips Trump's Inauguration, Sends Vice President Instead

Date: January 2025 | Source: CNN

Chinese President Xi Jinping will not attend President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration but will send Vice President Han Zheng as his special representative. This marks a significant diplomatic gesture as it breaks with tradition.

  • X Jinping declines to attend Trump's inauguration, sending Han Zheng instead.
  • The decision highlights evolving dynamics in US-China relations.
  • Other foreign leaders have been invited and plan to attend.
  • The Chinese foreign ministry emphasizes willingness to enhance dialogue with the new US government.
  • Experts interpret the move as symbolizing China’s flexible approach towards the US.
“We stand ready to work with the new US government...” - Chinese Foreign Ministry

This decision by Xi showcases China’s strategic diplomacy and willingness to engage with the incoming US administration while navigating complex international relations.
newTitle: Xi Jinping Skips Trump's Inauguration, Sends Vice President Instead

title: Centre revokes GRAP 3 curbs in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels - Hindustan Times
summary:
Centre revokes GRAP 3 restrictions in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels, says order

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's air quality panel has revoked the GRAP 3 restrictions in the Delhi-NCR due to improved air quality. This decision follows the earlier revocation of GRAP 4 restrictions.

  • GRAP 3 restrictions were revoked as pollution levels dipped.
  • Classes up to grade 5 will transition to hybrid mode.
  • Restrictions on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles remain in place.
  • Pollution traditionally peaks during winters due to various local sources.
“As per the air quality and weather forecast provided by IMD/IITM, there is a likelihood of AQI to remain in lower end of the Very Poor category in the coming days owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and strong wind speeds,” said CAQM.

This change in restrictions is hoped to improve daily life while maintaining surveillance on air quality management as necessary.
newTitle: Centre Revokes GRAP 3 Restrictions in Delhi-NCR Amid Pollution Drop

title: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results FY 2025: Check quarterly earnings of Mukesh Ambani-led NBFC - Financial performance details - ET Now
summary:
Jio Financial Services Q3 Results FY 2025

Updated: January 17, 2025 19:17 IST

Jio Financial Services Ltd has reported its earnings for the quarter ended December 31, 2024, indicating a flat growth across key metrics.

  • Consolidated profit after tax (PAT) is Rs 295 crore, a growth of 0.3% YoY.
  • Revenue reported at Rs 438 crore, marking a 6.1% increase YoY.
  • AUM (Assets Under Management) stands at Rs 4,199 crore, a significant rise from Q2 FY25.
  • Net profit decline of 57% QoQ from Rs 689 crore in Q2 FY25.
  • Shares ended at Rs 279.05, up 0.83% from the previous close.

Key Highlights

  • Payments bank CASA customers at 1.89 million (+25% QoQ).
  • Payment solutions embedded in JioBharat for merchant onboarding at scale.
  • Insurance broking now across categories and three channels.
  • 7.4 million average MAU across all digital properties of JFSL.

(Disclaimer: The above article is meant for informational purposes only, and should not be considered as any investment advice.)
newTitle: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results FY 2025: Overview of Quarterly Earnings

title: 'Saif Ali Khan wasn't scared': Autorickshaw driver who transported actor to hospital - Hindustan Times
summary:
Autorickshaw Driver Describes Transporting Saif Ali Khan to Hospital After Stabbing

Published on: Jan 17, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

An auto-rickshaw driver narrated the dramatic events of transporting a bleeding Saif Ali Khan to Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital after the actor was stabbed while protecting his family. The incident raised questions about security and personal safety for public figures.

  • The driver, Bhajan Singh Rana, found Khan bleeding profusely from the neck.
  • Rana did not recognize the actor initially and took approximately 8-10 minutes to reach the hospital.
  • Upon arrival, Khan asked the guard for a stretcher, stating, "I am Saif Ali Khan."
  • Rana revealed that a young boy was also accompanying Khan in the auto-rickshaw.
  • Khan did not appear scared and managed to walk into the hospital without assistance.
“He (Saif) walked into the auto... he did not seem scared and appeared normal,” said Rana.

This incident highlights the unforeseen dangers faced by celebrities and raises concerns about their safety in public and private spaces.
newTitle: Autorickshaw Driver Describes Transporting Saif Ali Khan to Hospital After Stabbing

title: Jio Financial Q3 Results | Net profit flat at ₹295 crore, revenue up 6% to ₹438 crore - CNBCTV18
summary:
Jio Financial Q3 Results | Net profit flat at ₹295 crore, revenue rises 6% to ₹438 crore

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: CNBCTV18

Jio Financial Services Ltd (JFSL) reported a net profit of ₹294.8 crore for Q3 FY25, reflecting a marginal increase of 0.3% year-on-year, while revenues rose 6% to ₹438.4 crore.

  • Share price of JFSL closed at ₹279.05, up 0.83%.
  • The company's assets under management (AUM) increased significantly to ₹4,199 crore.
  • JFSL's customer base for CASA grew by 25% quarter-on-quarter to 1.89 million.
  • JFSL integrated payment solutions into JioBharat, enhancing its digital footprint with 7.4 million monthly active users (MAUs).
  • Marketing partnership established with MyJio app for customer acquisition.
“Shares of Jio Financial Services Ltd ended at ₹279.05, up by ₹2.30, or 0.83%, on the BSE.”

JFSL's results show steady growth despite flat profits, indicating a strong position in the digital finance sector.
newTitle: Jio Financial Q3 Results: Flat Net Profit and Rising Revenue

title: 12 Indians serving with Russian military killed, 16 more are missing, says MEA - Hindustan Times
summary:
12 Indians Serving with Russian Military Killed, 16 More Missing

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian government has confirmed the death of 12 nationals serving with the Russian armed forces, with an additional 16 individuals reported missing, raising concerns over the treatment and recruitment of Indians in foreign military services.

  • 12 Indians confirmed dead in the conflict.
  • 16 Indians listed as missing.
  • A total of 126 Indians were serving with the Russian military, with 96 returned.
  • The Indian government remains engaged with Russian authorities regarding the missing individuals.
  • Previous reports had confirmed only 9 deaths.
  • Indian authorities claim many individuals were misled by recruitment agents.
“Twelve Indian nationals have died in the conflict, who were serving in the Russian Army.” - Randhir Jaiswal, Spokesperson for the External Affairs Ministry.

The Indian government is advocating for the release of all Indian nationals serving in the Russian military, emphasizing ongoing concerns about the recruitment practices and safety of those involved.
newTitle: 12 Indians Serving with Russian Military Killed, 16 More Missing

title: What Erling Haaland's incredible new 10-year contract means for Man City - and the rest of football: Escaping serious FFP punishment, life after Pep Guardiola and a bitter blow for Galactico-chasing Real Madrid - Goal.com
summary:
What Erling Haaland's Incredible New 10-Year Contract Means for Man City - and the Rest of Football

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Goal

The Norwegian's historic deal is a statement of confidence from the Cityzens amid Premier League scrutiny and a message to rivals.

  • Erling Haaland has signed the longest contract in football history, a 10-year deal with Manchester City.
  • The contract reflects City's trust in Haaland to lead the team beyond Pep Guardiola's tenure.
  • Haaland has scored 111 goals in 126 appearances for City.
  • This new contract effectively ends Real Madrid's hopes of signing the player.
  • City's sporting director emphasized Haaland's potential to create an incredible legacy at the club.
“I am super proud and happy and I am looking forward to staying here for a long time.” - Erling Haaland

Haaland's commitment to Manchester City is seen as a declaration of confidence in the club's future competitiveness.
newTitle: What Erling Haaland's Incredible New 10-Year Contract Means for Man City and Football
